snippet: A former general gained support from members of the army in eastern Libya and killed two dozen people in and around Benghazi, according to news reports.
abstract: Khalifa Heftar, former general who was central figure in Libya's revolution, leads full-scale ground and air assault on several Islamist bases in and around city of Benghazi; Heftar has declared war against groups that have been accused of conducting campaign of lawlessness and assassinations.

byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and CARLOTTA GALL
byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway reported from Tripoli, and Carlotta Gall from Djerba, Tunisia.

lead_paragraph: A former general gained support from members of the army in eastern Libya and killed two dozen people in and around Benghazi, according to news reports.

headline.main: Key Figure in Libya’s Revolution Leads Attack on Islamists
headline.print_headline: Key Figure in Libya’s Revolution Leads Attack on Islamists
